clinch.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to finally agree on something or get something after trying very hard
clinch.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: a young salesman eager to clinch the deal
A last-minute touchdown clinched the game.
clinch.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if two people clinch, they hold each other’s arms tightly, especially when fighting
clinch.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a situation in which two people hold each other’s arms tightly, especially when they are fighting
clinch.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a situation in which two people who love each other hold each other tightly
clinch.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to finally succeed in getting or winning something
clinch.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: Advertising creates the interest, but personal selling clinches the deal.
